description: '''Aḥwash''' ([[Tifinagh|Neo-Tifinagh]]: {{lang|ber|ⴰⵃⵡⴰⵛ}}, [[International Phonetic Alphabet|IPA]] /æħwæʃ/, also [[Romanization|Romanized]] as '''{{transliteration|ar|ahwach}}''' or '''{{transliteration|ar|ahouach}}''') is a [[Shilha people|Shilha]] style of collective performance, including dance, singing, poetry and percussion, from southern [[Morocco]]. The ''ahwash'' is performed on the occasion of local festivals as a celebration of the community.
